original: Eldh, Albert, konstnär, Göteborg, f. 17/8/78 i Film, Upps. 1., av Jan Petter E. o. Maria Wickman. G. 04 m. Alice Henrikson. Barn: Lisa, Thore, Gunnar o. Gösta. — Stud. v. tekn. sk. i Upps. 91-93, v. Musei rit- o. målarsk. i Gbg 03-04, v. Konstn:förb. målarsk. i Sthlm 06-07. Studires. i Frankr., HoE. o. Tyskl. 00. Lär. i dekorativ måln. o. figurteckn :grafik v. Slöjd-fören. i Gbg konsthantvisk. 09-39. Bl arb.: kartonger t. glasmåln. i ett flert. kyrkor, fresker o. skulptur, t. kyrkor o. priv. byggn., oljemåln., akvar., bok-iriustr., grafik. Repr. i mus. i Lund.
translated: Eldh, Albert, artist, from Gothenburg, born August 17, 1878 in Film, Uppsala county, first-born of Jan Petter E. and Maria Wickman. Married in 1904 to Alice Henrikson, children: Lisa, Thore, Gunnar and Gösta. Studied at the Technical School in Uppsala from 1891-1893, at the Museum of Drawing and Painting in Gothenburg from 1903-1904, and at the Art Association of Stockholm's School of Painting from 1906-1907. Studied in France, Holland, and Germany in 1900. Taught decorative painting and figure drawing and graphics at the Craft Association in Gothenburg from 1909-1939. Created designs for stained glass windows in several churches, frescoes and sculpture for churches and private buildings, oil paintings, watercolors, book illustrations, and graphics. Represented in museums in Lund.
